channel.title: Punishment bribery
channel.description:
I'm not sure I like this new trend,
http://www.moparcraft.net/smf/index.php/topic,534999.0.html
Paying 20 diamonds for someone to remove a report and pretend it never happened, I don't know but that doesn't seem very justified to me. I don't like how this is going basically if someone where to burn down an entire city and he paid the owner e.g. 50 xrayed diamonds he would then apparently not be banned because he was pardoned.
It seems like a way to just profit expensive, cheated materials from griefers instead of enforcing the rules correctly.

item.title: Punishment bribery
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It looks like, at least in that case, that it was an accident. So if they want to work it out between themselves I don’t see a problem with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Punishment bribery
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

I think it’s a good idea, I’ll rewrite my rules.

Read full topic

item.title: Punishment bribery
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I agree, Si force.

I’ve been trying to say something along those lines but I’ve been having a hard time wording it I guess

Read full topic

item.title: Punishment bribery
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

I think we should be acting as seperate to the report. If the person wishes to withdraw his report, we should still act basing our actions on the fact that the rules were still broken. If we do this, then ‘bribing’ shouldn’t be a problem since it would be useless.

Read full topic

item.title: Punishment bribery
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Maybe, in this case. But that doesn’t mean it should be acceptable…I’ve identified the risks so ignoring them would be an act of stupidity more than anything.

Also, look away from the abuse part - The server rules MUST be enforced that’s what they’re there for.

Read full topic

item.title: Punishment bribery
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

He did say it was a accident tho so I don’t see any intention to do harm in this case.

Read full topic

item.title: Punishment bribery
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Yes, if someone griefs anothers property the intention to do harm is still there. Simply saying “Pay me 20 diamonds and we’ll pretend it never happened” isn’t working for me. It also opens the possibility to manipulation e.g.

Pay me 5 diamonds a week or I bring the report back up and you’ll be banned.

Basically it gives idiots like Agl power over people who made a mistake, or power over griefers in general. It also isn’t setting the rules of the server at all it’s basically saying you can grief, if you have enough diamonds to pay the person to shut up.

Read full topic

item.title: Punishment bribery
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

First and foremost agl uses Internet Explorer LOL.

Well as far as I know its up to the person who made the report whether or not they want to accept payment for the damage and then just let it go.

But basically you want it so the state(game staff) can press charges even if the plaintiff(agl) decides to drop it and accept payment(bribe) from the defendant
(jrub)?

Read full topic
